venue.name: King Arthur's Renaissance Faire (CT not MA!!)

item.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

Would you enjoy seeing Jousting Knights on horseback? Birds of prey soaring through the air? Women with overflowing bosoms and men in jerkins and tights? How about imbibing cups of Mead and feasting on turkey drumsticks? Watching acrobats, fire eaters, musicians, comedy and magic performances?

AND have it interpreted in ASL?

If you think this sounds like a day of fun, come join Simone and "CT ASL Meetup" and folks from BOSTON ASL for DEAF AWARENESS DAY (Oct. 9) at the Connecticut Renaissance Faire (King Arthur's Renaissance Faire) when "Finger Dancers" from around New England come to interpret a variety of different shows throughout the day for our friends who are Deaf / Hard of Hearing.


For more information about the Faire, see: www.ctfaire.com/fall

We'll all meet at the front near the ticketing area at NOON (Faire open 10am to 6pm)

Located at the Lions Fairgrounds, Hebron, Connecticut. Tickets $15. FREE Parking!!
Feel free to wear your costumes if you have any!

Let's see about carpooling, as this is a bit of a distance away!!

Hope to see many BOSTON ASL members go, excited to meet CT ASL Meetup folks, and see what type of "costumes" we can come up with!

TAKE CARE!!

Connie / Erika / Marc / Russ


P.S. I contacted King Richard's Faire here in Canton, MA, to see if they had something similar. Alas, they do not (However, with my not-so-subtle -- but nicely worded! -- they may do so in the future!).
item.how_to_find_us: Meet just outside ticket booth - I MAY be wearing LARGE Black Feathered Headdress/Mask
item.name: Connecticut Renaissance Faire - Deaf Awareness Day
